info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 11 at 8:39PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect until 4 AM MST Saturday... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is HIGH. * WHERE...The southern Salmon River, Sawtooth, White Cloud, Smoky, Boulder, Pioneer, and Soldier Mountains, including the mountains surrounding Banner Summit, Stanley, Smiley Creek, Atlanta, Galena Summit, Trail Creek Summit, and Fairfield. The backcountry avalanche warning does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...In effect from Thu 20:00 MST to Sat 04:00 MST. * IMPACTS...An intense storm bringing heavy snow and strong winds will overload a very weak snowpack. Natural and human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are almost certain to occur. Very large avalanches large enough to destroy a house may occur naturally. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes—slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely—from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
